name: FMOD Sound Bank
summary: Learn about .FSB files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Firelight Technologies FMOD Designer was a program that video game developers and sound designers used to create and package sounds for use in console and PC games. After a user finished designing their game's sounds, they would package those sounds in a single FSB archive. They could then integrate the archive, and accompanying audio event data saved in an FEV file, into their game.
NOTE: FMOD Designer has been replaced by FMOD Studio, which uses .BANK files instead of FSB files.

instructions: You can use FSB Extractor (Windows) to extract the individual audio files that an FSB file contains. You can use any of the following programs to play the audio that FSB files contain:
Foobar2000, with the vgmstream plug-in installed (Windows)
Nullsoft Winamp, with the vgmstream plug-in installed (Windows)
With the vgmstream plug-in installed, you can use Foobar2000 to convert FSB files to .WAV (WAVE Audio) and other common audio formats.
